trial_identification.studytitle: A randomised controlled trial of behavioural interventions for infant sleep disturbance.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised controlled trial of behavioural interventions for infants with sleep disturbance: effect on sleep, parental and infant stress and attachment.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Conditions of unknown or disputed aetiology (such as chronic fatigue syndrome/myalgic encephalomyelitis)

interventions.interventions: Graduated Extinction (gradually extending the time between the infants' cry and the parents' response to the infant: response time night 1, 2-6min; night 2, 3-7min; night 3, 5-15min; night 4, 10-20 min; night 5, 15-25 min; night 6, 20-30min; night 7, 25-35min [duration of treatment =1 week]) vs. Bedtime Fading (bedtime restriction therapy: gradually reducing infants' time in bed to more closely match their total sleep time, 15-min changes to bedtime made once per night until desired bedtime is reached [duration of treatment=1 week]). Parents supported with 24/7 mobile phone support during treatment, when needed.
interventions.comparator: Sleep Education (educating parents about infants' average nocturnal sleep time, individual difference in sleep obtained, sleep architecture (eg, sleep stages) and napping). Administered in a single 50-minute session on an individual basis.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Sleep (including sleep onset latency and wake after sleep onset, both in minutes; and the number of nocturnal awakenings). Outcome assessed with parent-completed 7-day sleep diaries of their infant's sleep, as well as a activity monitor worn on the infant's ankle.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Pre-treatment, 1 week after beginning treatment, 1 month after, 3 months after and 12 months after.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: pre-treatment, 1 week-, 1 month-, 3 months- and 12 months after treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Parental (self-reported) stress, as measured by the Stress subscale of the Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (Short Form).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: pre-treatment, 1 week-, 1 month-, 3 months- and 12 months after treatment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Infants identified by their parents as possessing a sleep problem; sleep onset latency > 30 min; wake after sleep onset > 60 min; number of awakenings > 3.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Atypically developing infants (physical and mental); clinical levels of maternal post-natal depression.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study evaluates the sleep, stress and attachment outcomes for infants and parents undergoing behavioural interventions using a randomised controlled design.
